an10.82:4.1: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
an10.82:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
an10.82:5.1: “Ānanda, it’s not possible for a faithless mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an10.82:6.1: It’s not possible for a mendicant who is unethical …
an10.82:14.1: of wrong view to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an10.82:15.1: It’s not possible for a mendicant with these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an10.82:16.1: It is possible for a faithful mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an10.82:17.1: It is possible for a mendicant who is unethical …
an10.82:25.1: of right view to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an10.82:26.1: It is possible for a mendicant with these ten qualities to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.”
